Model: Ex Vivo Live Tumor Diagnostic (Microfluidic Platform)
Organs/Tissues: Patient-derived tumor cells (e.g. prostate, breast, bladder, lung cancers)
Physiological/Pathological: Pathological tumor environment ex vivo. Observes intrinsic cell aggressiveness
Cell Source: Primary cells from fresh tumor biopsy (no immortalized lines), short-term culture
Multiple Cell Types: Mostly tumor epithelial cells; some stromal cells may be present from biopsy
Stromal Cells: Not intentionally co-cultured; occasionally present from sample
Tissue-resident Immune: No active immune co-culture. Any immune cells are incidental in biopsy
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No. Single tissue (tumor) model per chip
Air-Liquid Interface: No, cells submerged in microfluidic chamber
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, proprietary matrix coating that supports rapid tumor cell adhesion
3D Scaffold: Primarily 2D or 2.5D cell arrangement on ECM. Not forming 3D spheroids
Notable Features: Live single-cell phenotyping for aggressiveness, short assay (<48h). CLIA diagnostic approach
Plate/Format (Throughput): Custom microfluidic chip (1 sample/chip). Low throughput, clinical test
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, time-lapse brightfield/fluorescence, AI analysis of cell motility & morphology
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: No. Focus on cell imaging, not secreted factors
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Generally no, final step is imaging-based. Cells may be fixed/stained
Perfused: Static after seeding, minimal fluid exchange
Real-time Microenvironment Control: None. Observe baseline tumor cell behavior on matrix
model_availability: Service-based. Each patient sample tested in Cellanyx lab
